intro: Hieracium alatum subsp. thalianum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. The plant has alternate, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purple underside. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. This species is characterized by its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common and sometimes invasive weed.
